author: Anonymous Scale
title: identity?
question:
I don't understand how identity works when we use abstract functions, for example:

(build-list n identity), why does it produce (0 1 . . . n-1 )?
student_answer:
Identity just outputs whatever came in. The reason we have this is because abstract functions like build-list require a function in order to work (of which it will apply to each of the elements of the list), but in some instances we don't want a function that changes anything. For example:
(identity 1) ; outputs 1
(identity "hello") ; outputs "hello"
